com.milk.uberchat.base
Class BaseChannel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseEntity
        |
        +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseLocus
              |
              +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseChannel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatChannel, ChatEntity, ChatLocus, Commandable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ICBChannel, IRCChannel, SBChannel
public abstract class BaseChannel
extends BaseLocus
implements ChatChannel

This is an abstract base class that provides a lot of what all ChatChannel implementors need.

Note that BaseChannel completely takes care of setting the description for its ChatEntity nature, so subclasses should not call BaseEntity.setDescription(). Unfortunately, Java doesn't provide a way to specify this restriction programatically. It just sucks that way sometimes.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

public int getJoinedState()

channelJoin

protected abstract void channelJoin()
BaseChannel calls this method when it actually wants to try to do a channel join. It will only call this if the channel has not in fact already been joined and is not in the process of being joined. By the time this is called, the state of the channel is already JOINING, and it is up to the subclass to call joinedChannel() or leftChannel() depending on the success or failure of the join attempt. In the case of success, it is also sufficient merely to call addUser() with the identity user as the argument.

channelLeave

protected abstract void channelLeave()
BaseChannel calls this method when it actually wants to try to do a channel leave. It will only call this if the channel is in fact currently joined. By the time this is called, the state of the channel is already LEAVING, and it is up to the subclass to call leftChannel() or joinedChannel() depending on the success or failure of the leave attempt. In the case of success, it is also sufficient merely to call removeUser() with the identity user as the argument.

listenerAdded

uberBroadcast

protected void uberBroadcast(BaseEvent event)

Broadcast an event to the appropriate uber-listeners of this entity. BaseChannel uses this to send the event to its ChatIdentity parent, but only if the parent is in fact a BaseEntity.

To repeat the note from BaseEntity: Subclasses may override this to send to additional listeners or perform needed actions, but overriding methods must call super.uberBroadcast(). Java has no way to enforce this, however. It just sucks that way sometimes.

Overrides:
uberBroadcast in class BaseEntity
Parameters:
event - the event to send

userAdded

protected void userAdded(ChatUser user)
BaseLocus calls this method when a user has been added. We use this to make sure that the user knows that it is in this channel, but we can only do this if the user in fact a BaseChannelHolder. Also, if the user is the identity user, this makes sure that the channel is considered joined.

Overrides:
userAdded in class BaseLocus
Parameters:
user - the user that was added

userRemoved

protected void userRemoved(ChatUser user)
BaseLocus calls this method when a user has been removed. We use this to make sure that the user knows that it is not in this channel, but we can only do this if the user in fact a BaseChannelHolder. Also, if the user is the identity user, this makes sure that the channel is considered left.

Overrides:
userRemoved in class BaseLocus
Parameters:
user - the user that was removed

nameChanged

protected void nameChanged()
BaseEntity calls this when the name and/or canonical name of this object changes. We use this to re-make the description, since it is in part based on the name.

Overrides:
nameChanged in class BaseEntity

joinedChannel

protected final void joinedChannel()
Tell the BaseChannel that the identity for this channel has in fact joined the channel. It sends out appropriate events, and makes sure that the identity user is in fact in the channel.

leftChannel

protected final void leftChannel()
Tell the BaseChannel that the identity for this channel has left the channel. It sends out appropriate events, and makes sure that the identity user is not in fact in the channel.

topicChanged

protected final void topicChanged(java.lang.String topic)
Tell the BaseChannel that the topic has changed.

topic - null-ok; the new topic for the channel
